description: From Latin aegilōps, from Ancient Greek αἰγίλωψ (aigílōps, “haver-grass, Aegilops neglecta”).

entries.meaning: An ulcer or fistula in the inner angle of the eye.
examples: If the ægilops be neglected, it bursts, and degenerates into a fistula, which eats into the bone.

entries.meaning: (obsolete) The goatgrass (Aegilops spp.) or other grass found as a corn-weed.
